013package org.apache.juneau.json;
014
015import java.io.*;
016
017import org.apache.juneau.*;
018import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
019import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
020
021/**
022 * Specialized writer for serializing JSON.
023 *
024 * <ul class='notes'>
025 *    <li class='note'>
026 *       This class is not intended for external use.
027 * </ul>
028 *
029 * <ul class='seealso'>
030 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.JsonDetails">JSON Details</a>
031
032 * </ul>
033 */
034public final class JsonWriter extends SerializerWriter {
035
036   private final boolean simpleAttrs, escapeSolidus;
037
038   // Characters that trigger special handling of serializing attribute values.
039   private static final AsciiSet
040      encodedChars = AsciiSet.create("\n\t\b\f\r'\"\\"),
041      encodedChars2 = AsciiSet.create("\n\t\b\f\r'\"\\/");
042
043   private static final KeywordSet reservedWords = new KeywordSet(
044      "arguments","break","case","catch","class","const","continue","debugger","default","delete",
045      "do","else","enum","eval","export","extends","false","finally","for","function","if",
046      "implements","import","in","instanceof","interface","let","new","null","package",
047      "private","protected","public","return","static","super","switch","this","throw",
048      "true","try","typeof","var","void","while","with","undefined","yield"
049   );
050
051
052   // Characters that represent attribute name characters that don't trigger quoting.
053   // These are actually more strict than the actual Javascript specification, but
054   // can be narrowed in the future if necessary.
055   // For example, we quote attributes that start with $ even though we don't need to.
056   private static final AsciiSet validAttrChars = AsciiSet.create().ranges("a-z","A-Z","0-9").chars("_").build();
057   private static final AsciiSet validFirstAttrChars = AsciiSet.create().ranges("a-z","A-Z").chars("_").build();
058
059   private final AsciiSet ec;
060
061   /**
062    * Constructor.
063    *
064    * @param out The writer being wrapped.
065    * @param useWhitespace If <jk>true</jk>, tabs and spaces will be used in output.
066    * @param maxIndent The maximum indentation level.
067    * @param escapeSolidus If <jk>true</jk>, forward slashes should be escaped in the output.
068    * @param quoteChar The quote character to use (i.e. <js>'\''</js> or <js>'"'</js>)
069    * @param simpleAttrs If <jk>true</jk>, JSON attributes will only be quoted when necessary.
070    * @param trimStrings If <jk>true</jk>, strings will be trimmed before being serialized.
071    * @param uriResolver The URI resolver for resolving URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
072    */
073   protected JsonWriter(Writer out, boolean useWhitespace, int maxIndent, boolean escapeSolidus, char quoteChar,
074         boolean simpleAttrs, boolean trimStrings, UriResolver uriResolver) {
075      super(out, useWhitespace, maxIndent, trimStrings, quoteChar, uriResolver);
076      this.simpleAttrs = simpleAttrs;
077      this.escapeSolidus = escapeSolidus;
078      this.ec = escapeSolidus ? encodedChars2 : encodedChars;
079   }
080
081   /**
082    * Serializes the specified object as a JSON string value.
083    *
084    * @param s The object being serialized.
085    * @return This object.
086    */
087   public JsonWriter stringValue(String s) {
088      if (s == null)
089         return this;
090      boolean doConvert = false;
091      for (int i = 0; i < s.length() && ! doConvert; i++) {
092         char c = s.charAt(i);
093         doConvert |= ec.contains(c);
094      }
095      q();
096      if (! doConvert) {
097         w(s);
098      } else {
099         for (int i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
100            char c = s.charAt(i);
101            if (ec.contains(c)) {
102               if (c == '\n')
103                  w('\\').w('n');
104               else if (c == '\t')
105                  w('\\').w('t');
106               else if (c == '\b')
107                  w('\\').w('b');
108               else if (c == '\f')
109                  w('\\').w('f');
110               else if (c == quoteChar)
111                  w('\\').w(quoteChar);
112               else if (c == '\\')
113                  w('\\').w('\\');
114               else if (c == '/' && escapeSolidus)
115                  w('\\').w('/');
116               else if (c != '\r')
117                  w(c);
118            } else {
119               w(c);
120            }
121         }
122      }
123      q();
124      return this;
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Serializes the specified object as a JSON attribute name.
129    *
130    * @param s The object being serialized.
131    * @return This object.
132    */
133   public JsonWriter attr(String s) {
134
135      if (trimStrings)
136         s = StringUtils.trim(s);
137
138      /*
139       * Converts a Java string to an acceptable JSON attribute name. If
140       * simpleAttrs is true, then quotes will only be used if the attribute
141       * name consists of only alphanumeric characters.
142       */
143      boolean doConvert = ! simpleAttrs;     // Always convert when not in lax mode.
144
145      // If the attribute is null, it must always be printed as null without quotes.
146      // Technically, this isn't part of the JSON spec, but it does allow for null key values.
147      if (s == null) {
148         s = "null";
149         doConvert = false;
150
151      } else {
152
153         // Look for characters that would require the attribute to be quoted.
154         // All possible numbers should be caught here.
155         if (! doConvert) {
156            for (int i = 0; i < s.length() && ! doConvert; i++) {
157               char c = s.charAt(i);
158               doConvert |= ! (i == 0 ? validFirstAttrChars.contains(c) : validAttrChars.contains(c));
159            }
160         }
161
162         // Reserved words and blanks must be quoted.
163         if (! doConvert) {
164            if (s.isEmpty() || reservedWords.contains(s))
165               doConvert = true;
166         }
167      }
168
169      // If no conversion necessary, just print the attribute as-is.
170      if (doConvert)
171         stringValue(s);
172      else
173         w(s);
174
175      return this;
176   }
177
178   /**
179    * Appends a URI to the output.
180    *
181    * @param uri The URI to append to the output.
182    * @return This object.
183    */
184   public SerializerWriter uriValue(Object uri) {
185      return stringValue(uriResolver.resolve(uri));
186   }
187
188   /**
189    * Performs an indentation only if we're currently past max indentation.
190    *
191    * @param depth The current indentation depth.
192    * @return This object.
193    */
194   public JsonWriter smi(int depth) {
195      if (depth > maxIndent)
196         super.s();
197      return this;
198   }
199
200   /**
201    * Adds a space only if the current indentation level is below maxIndent.
202    *
203    * @param indent The number of spaces to indent.
204    * @return This object.
205    */
206   public JsonWriter s(int indent) {
207      if (indent <= maxIndent)
208         super.s();
209      return this;
210   }
211
212   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
213   // Overridden methods
214   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
215
216   // <FluentSetters>
217
218   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
219   public JsonWriter cr(int depth) {
220      super.cr(depth);
221      return this;
222   }
223
224   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
225   public JsonWriter cre(int depth) {
226      super.cre(depth);
227      return this;
228   }
229
230   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
231   public JsonWriter appendln(int indent, String text) {
232      super.appendln(indent, text);
233      return this;
234   }
235
236   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
237   public JsonWriter appendln(String text) {
238      super.appendln(text);
239      return this;
240   }
241
242   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
243   public JsonWriter append(int indent, String text) {
244      super.append(indent, text);
245      return this;
246   }
247
248   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
249   public JsonWriter append(int indent, char c) {
250      super.append(indent, c);
251      return this;
252   }
253
254   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
255   public JsonWriter s() {
256      super.s();
257      return this;
258   }
259
260   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
261   public JsonWriter w(char value) {
262      super.w(value);
263      return this;
264   }
265
266   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
267   public JsonWriter w(String value) {
268      super.w(value);
269      return this;
270   }
271
272   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
273   public JsonWriter q() {
274      super.q();
275      return this;
276   }
277
278   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
279   public JsonWriter i(int indent) {
280      super.i(indent);
281      return this;
282   }
283
284   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
285   public JsonWriter nl(int indent) {
286      super.nl(indent);
287      return this;
288   }
289
290   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
291   public JsonWriter append(Object text) {
292      super.append(text);
293      return this;
294   }
295
296   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
297   public JsonWriter append(String text) {
298      super.append(text);
299      return this;
300   }
301
302   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
303   public JsonWriter appendIf(boolean b, String text) {
304      super.appendIf(b, text);
305      return this;
306   }
307
308   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
309   public JsonWriter appendIf(boolean b, char c) {
310      super.appendIf(b, c);
311      return this;
312   }
313
314   @Override /* SerializerWriter */
315   public JsonWriter append(char c) {
316      super.append(c);
317      return this;
318   }
319
320   // </FluentSetters>
321}
